definition: lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
pole
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
picture/image/film/movie/photograph/reflection/shadow/trace

sentences.english: Music therapy does not cure at once.
sentences.chinese: 音乐疗法并不能立竿见影。

sentences.english: This is an immediate consequence of the JOSH stack.
sentences.chinese: 这就是JOSH组合立竿见影的效果。

sentences.english: The results from repeal were both immediate and amazing.
sentences.chinese: 撤销禁酒令的结果是最立竿见影和最传奇的。

sentences.english: And it would have the advantage of an almost instant off switch.
sentences.chinese: 它的优势是将会产生立竿见影的效果。

sentences.english: A big change in an exchange rate seems at first glance that it should have an immediate impact.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，汇率大变似乎该有立竿见影的效果。

sentences.english: If we stop eating meat completely, the cooling effect will be almost immediate.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们彻底停止吃肉，其冷却效果几乎是立竿见影。

sentences.english: He looks for an immediate return on that ad buy.
sentences.chinese: 对于购买的广告，他寻求立竿见影的回报。

sentences.english: The lesson was crystal clear, and its effects were immediate.
sentences.chinese: 梦给他上的一课像水晶般透明，而且立竿见影。

sentences.english: If you are looking for instant-gratification, try a 5k.
sentences.chinese: 如果你寻求的是立竿见影的效果，那么试试5km吧。

sentences.english: No other diet or weight-loss approach is remotely as effective as bariatric surgery.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么节食或减肥方法比减肥手术更加立竿见影。

sentences.english: They're an on-demand group accustomed to seeing immediate results.
sentences.chinese: 他们是一个按需团体，习惯于看到立竿见影的效果。

sentences.english: Persuasion is great for immediate effect, but learning matters over the long-haul.
sentences.chinese: 劝说有立竿见影的效果，学习却是长途旅行。

definition: lit. put up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); to expect instant results
to have the desired effect
result/effect/efficacy/(theater) sound or visual effects
effect/result
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
to yield results
to show results/effective
to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
half the work, twice the effect (idiom); the right approach saves effort and leads to better results/a stitch in time saves nine
to show an effect/to produce an effect/a conspicuous effect
to take radical measures/to get to the root (of a problem etc)
lit. to paint holding two brushes (idiom); fig. to work on two tasks at the same time/to attack one problem from two angles at the same time
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
to produce the opposite of the desired result
very small/very little/scant/minimal
to get sth done once and for all
